title: Deploy unchanged portfolio site based on provided React/Tailwind component

requirements.text: Create the portfolio single-page UI in the React+TypeScript frontend to match the exact structure and content of the user-provided `Portfolio` component (sections: Home, About, Skills, Projects, Resume, Contact), including the same text, links, and section anchors (`#home`, `#about`, etc.) without changing profile content.

quotes: just make the same profile no need to change anything and deploy this portfolio

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders a fixed navbar with section links: Home, About, Skills, Projects, Resume, Contact.
Each section exists with the same headings and paragraphs as provided, and navbar links scroll to the correct section IDs.
The Contact section includes the same GitHub, LinkedIn, and email links as in the provided code (no content changes).
The Resume section contains a working download link to `/resume.pdf` (file may be added separately).

requirements.text: Add and configure required frontend dependencies to support the provided UI code: Framer Motion animations, TypeAnimation typing effect, and Lucide icon components; ensure the build compiles successfully under the existing React+TypeScript template.
acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or the project’s equivalent) succeeds without TypeScript errors.
Animations (Framer Motion) and typing effect (TypeAnimation) render in the browser.
Lucide icons render for GitHub/LinkedIn/Mail in the Contact section.

requirements.text: Ensure static asset support for the resume download by serving `resume.pdf` from the frontend public/static assets path such that it is accessible at `/resume.pdf` in the deployed app.

quotes: Place your resume file as `resume.pdf` inside the `public` folder (public/resume.pdf)

acceptanceCriteria: When `resume.pdf` is present in the frontend public assets, navigating to `/resume.pdf` works in local and deployed environments.
Clicking “Download Resume” opens/downloads the PDF in a new tab as coded.

requirements.text: Deploy the portfolio application to the Internet Computer using the project’s standard dfx workflow (build frontend + deploy canisters) and provide a short set of deployment instructions in a README for reproducing the deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: A `dfx deploy` workflow produces an accessible frontend canister URL that serves the portfolio SPA.
README includes the minimal steps/commands to run locally and deploy (e.g., install deps, start local replica, deploy).
No backend features beyond template defaults are required to view the portfolio.

constraints: Do not change the profile content, project descriptions, section titles, or links from what the user provided.

Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, or `frontend/src/main.tsx` (compose around them instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services or external databases.
No third-party auth providers; only Internet Identity is supported (and not required for this portfolio).
nonGoals: Adding a CMS/admin editor for portfolio content.
Adding new sections/features not present in the provided component (e.g., blog, testimonials, analytics).
Deploying to Vercel/Netlify/AWS or any non-Internet-Computer hosting.
Implementing contact form submission/email sending (mailto link only).
